results.title: Acids, bases and salts. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Differing in their reaction with indicators, acids can be defined as proton acceptors using the Bronsted-Lowry theory. The Lewis theory is also explained, as well as the meaning of pH.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur and Coronet Films

group_siblings.title: Chemical bonding and atomic structure. - 2nd ed.
group_siblings.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur, Coronet Films and Don Lane Pictures

results.title: Chemical bonding and atomic structure. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur, Coronet Films and Don Lane Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
The substances forming our world are composed of atoms held together by powerful electrical forces called chemical bonds. The physical and chemical properties of elements and compounds depend on the nature of these bonds. Discusses metallic, ionic, covalent and interatomic bonds and forces dealing with ions, atoms, crystals, valence, polarity and Van der Waals forces. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur, Coronet Films and Don Lane Pictures

results.title: Chemical bond and atomic structure
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Discusses the structure of the atom and shows how the electrons help determine the way in which the atom bonds chemically with other atoms. Shows three types of chemical bonding and explains how bonding affects substance. (Suitable for years 11-12)

results.title: Buying services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows the need for savings and the importance of investing wisely. Uses the experiences of a young man involved in an automobile accident to illustrate the importance of being financially prepared through having shopped around for the best insurance cover. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying on credit
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Creative Establishment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows what credit is, how it works and some of the dangers involved in using credit. Uses a conversation between three young men to introduce finance charges, bank loans, downpayment, interest and instalment payments. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying for long-term use
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows a panel of consumers turning back the clock a year and telling how accurate their predictions have been for major purchases made a year ago. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying for immediate use
results.creator_credit: Frieda Dejarnette, Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Rates the consumer shopping skills of three young shoppers making typical purchases for immediate use. Illustrates judging quality, price and service and determining which of these factors are valuable in making these purchases. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Budgeting your money
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
This film shows four young people in different financial situations discussing their budgeting problems in conversations which lead to information on how budgets are made and carried out. Suitable for upper secondary level.
